title: Government forced to axe plans for new probate fee 'death tax'
text:
The Ministry of Justice (MoJ) has bowed to pressure and abandoned its plan for a dramatic increase in probate fees, following a campaign by this newspaper.

The radical proposal was slammed as a backdoor “stealth tax” and “abuse of power” by MPs and others. It would have increased the cost of applying for a grant of probate from the current £215, or £155 for solicitors, to £6,000 for the largest estates – a difference of 3,770pc.

But Lords, MPs and industry experts accused the Government of trying to introduce a new death tax on top of existing inheritance tax levies. Despite previously insisting the plans would go ahead, the MoJ confirmed the project has been abandoned.
